<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 415, 662, 433]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 446, 750, 464]]<|/det|>

<label>4</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 71, 866, 91]]<|/det|>
A student investigates the effect of changing the colour of light on the focal length of a lens.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 101, 633, 125]]<|/det|>
The focal length \(f\) of a lens is given by the equation \(f = \frac{uv}{(u + v)}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 136, 918, 170]]<|/det|>
The distance \(u\) is the distance between an object and the lens. The distance \(v\) is the distance between the lens and the image that is formed on a screen.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 183, 918, 217]]<|/det|>
Plan an experiment to investigate the effect of changing the colour of light on the focal length of a lens.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 230, 537, 248]]<|/det|>
The following apparatus is available to the student:

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 262, 304, 278]]<|/det|>
· illuminated object

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 277, 660, 294]]<|/det|>
· a selection of coloured filters to change the colour of the light

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 293, 292, 308]]<|/det|>
· converging lens

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 308, 217, 323]]<|/det|>
· screen

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 323, 253, 339]]<|/det|>
· metre ruler.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 354, 740, 371]]<|/det|>
Other apparatus normally available in a school laboratory can also be used.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 384, 324, 402]]<|/det|>
In your plan, you should:

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 415, 707, 433]]<|/det|>
· draw a labelled diagram to show the arrangement of the apparatus

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 432, 918, 463]]<|/det|>
· explain briefly how you would do the investigation, including the measurements you would take

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 463, 918, 495]]<|/det|>
· draw a suitable table, with column headings, to show how you would display your readings (you are not required to enter any readings in the table)

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 494, 648, 511]]<|/det|>
· state how you would use your results to reach a conclusion.

<|ref|>title<|/ref|><|det|>[[435, 73, 561, 88]]<|/det|>
